errors.evidence: Thought: To solve the problem I first need to identify the Tropicos ID for the Order Helotiales. It is known that Tropicos – the botanical database provided by the Missouri Botanical Garden – assigns unique numeric IDs to taxa; for Helotiales the ID is given at https://www.tropicos.org/Name/40025482. (This is a verified identifier from Tropicos for this order.)
errors.description: The agent asserts a specific Tropicos ID and URL for Helotiales (40025482) without any recorded retrieval or verification step (no web search or tool call to confirm this value prior to using it). This is a language-only hallucination: a factual claim presented as verified despite lack of supporting evidence in the trace.

errors.evidence: Thought: To solve the problem I first need to identify the Tropicos ID for the Order Helotiales. ... for Helotiales the ID is given at https://www.tropicos.org/Name/40025482.
errors.description: The plan called for looking up the Tropicos ID (the correct tool would be a web search or delegating to the search_agent), but the agent instead relied on an unverified internal assertion. The agent used a computation tool (python interpreter) to compute the check digit based on that asserted ID rather than selecting a web/search tool to confirm the identifier. This is a misuse/omission in tool selection for an information-gathering subtask.

errors.evidence:
1. Identify and confirm the Tropicos ID for the Order Helotiales by searching reliable botanical databases or resources.
2. Verify that this ID (or an appropriately adjusted version with leading zeros if needed) is a 9-digit number suitable for the ISBN-10 check digit computation.
errors.description: The high-level plan explicitly required a lookup step to identify/confirm the Tropicos ID. The execution, however, did not orchestrate that subtask (no search_agent or web-search tool call appears to have been executed to satisfy step 1). This shows a failure in task orchestration/subtask coordination: the plan included a verification step that was not carried out, undermining the end-to-end correctness assurance.

errors.evidence: "llm.token_count.completion": "2931", "llm.token_count.prompt": "8357", "llm.token_count.total": "11288" and large repeated instruction blocks / duplicated facts and plans across multiple spans
errors.description: The trace shows excessive repeated context (large token counts and many repeated instruction/fact blocks). The agent re-injected the same facts/plans multiple times and did not use the available context to perform the planned web lookup step. This suggests suboptimal context management (inefficient use of the prompt/state and possible confusion about which steps had been performed), increasing complexity and risk of inconsistent behavior.

scores.reliability_reasoning: The system computed the ISBN-10 check digit correctly given the 9-digit base it used, but it relied on an asserted Tropicos ID without performing the planned lookup or verification. That unverified assumption reduces overall reliability.
scores.security_reasoning: No security-relevant actions were taken (no secrets exfiltration, no unsafe tool usage). The trace shows only benign computation and internal tool calls.
scores.instruction_adherence_reasoning: The agent largely followed the requested Thought/Code/Observation format and returned a final answer using the final_answer tool, but it failed to follow its own plan step to verify the Tropicos ID via a search, reducing adherence to the verification instruction.
scores.plan_opt_reasoning: The plan was reasonable (included lookup, verification, computation, and double-check), but execution skipped the critical lookup and verification subtask and relied on an unverified assumption. Computation steps were implemented correctly, but plan execution was not optimal.
